channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Deep pothole in road, surface collapsed & Barriers to collect, 22nd January
item.description:
This pothole near the entrance of the cut de sac section of Malden Road has had red barriers around it for about 2 or 3 months but has yet to be repaired. Yet it seems as though the report has been taken off this site? Also - outside 83 Malden Road there are 4 large red barriers that have been left there for over 2 months following a separate pothole repair - it looks like they have been forgotten - can they be picked up please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Malden Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 22nd January
item.description:
Some guttering has been dumped near the waste bin. It has been there for a few months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 22nd January
item.description:
Ivy is growing high up into the crown of a tree and could damage a well established large tree on a roundabout
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle path from Westall Green roundabout to green cycle path at railway bridge is full of broken tarmac and holes, 22nd January
item.description:
Particulalry bad where Glencairn Park Ave meets Lansdown Road and opposite Dean Close School but the whole path is in a dreadful and dangerous condition. Also doesn't help that the verge has grown over half the cycle lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shelburne Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 22nd January
item.description:
Customer has reported a tree that looks like it coul fall pretty soon. it has been overgrown with ivy for quite some time, he was cutting back the ivy on his prerty and he has noticed the tree was moving and that it is the ivy that is holding the tree up, he has mentioned that is an old crab apple tree
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Signs & Street Furniture problem, 22nd January
item.description:
School, 20mph sign has become dislodged from post. Please can this be removed and brought back to depot, stored in GCC compound. Further works required to refix to post (Damaged Traffic Sign)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No drainage, 22nd January
item.description:
On three separate occasions I have been walking too or from my daughter's preschool and been splashed. There is a dip in the road which doesn't drain into the nearby drains and fills up to the point where it thoroughly drenched the pavement and any pedestrians severely any time a car drives through.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Priors Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same
